abstract: Prize fever has breached the thick walls of government bureaucracy, with more federal agencies are using competitions as a strategy to spur innovation.
snippet: Prize fever has breached the thick walls of government bureaucracy, with more federal agencies are using competitions as a strategy to spur innovation.
lead_paragraph: In the wake of the $10 million X Prize and its success in launching a private manned spacecraft, more and more foundations and companies are looking to sponsor their own technological competitions.

headline.main: U.S. Offers Alphabet Soup of Innovation Prizes
